issue.title: Not reading tags in FLAC files
issue.body:
On 28.8 installed from git tree, Ubuntu 22.04.03 64bit

File scanner does not read tags from FLAC files, stores such as 'Unknown Artist', 'Unknown Album' etc.
OK with MP3 files.
Strangely, I have  owntone 28.8.127.git85929dc-1+buster on Raspbian Linux 10 where the problem does *not* manifest, on the same files.

A relevant log file entry:
[2023-10-26 19:25:52] [DEBUG]       db: Running query 'UPDATE files SET db_timestamp = 1698344752, disabled = 0 WHERE path = '/media/NAS/music/Music Library/Rush/Presto/09-Red Tide.flac' AND db_timestamp >= 1698344657;'
[2023-10-26 19:25:52] [DEBUG]       db: Running query 'SELECT f.id FROM files f WHERE f.path = '/media/NAS/music/Music Library/Rush/Presto/09-Red Tide.flac';'
[2023-10-26 19:25:52] [DEBUG]     scan: File has 1 streams
[2023-10-26 19:25:52] [DEBUG]     scan: Duration 270466 ms, bitrate 884 kbps, samplerate 44100 channels 2
[2023-10-26 19:25:52] [DEBUG]     scan: FLAC
[2023-10-26 19:25:52] [DEBUG]     scan: Picked up 0 tags from file metadata
[2023-10-26 19:25:52] [DEBUG]     scan: Picked up 0 tags with extra md_map
[2023-10-26 19:25:52] [DEBUG]     scan: Picked up 2 tags from file metadata
[2023-10-26 19:25:52] [DEBUG]     scan: Picked up 2 tags with generic md_map, 2 tags total
[2023-10-26 19:25:52] [DEBUG]   ffmpeg: Statistics: 98304 bytes read, 0 seeks
[2023-10-26 19:25:52] [DEBUG]       db: Running query 'UPDATE files SET path = '/media/NAS/music/Music Library/Rush/Presto/09-Red Tide.flac', virtual_path = '/file:/media/NAS/music/Music Library/Rush/Presto/09-Red Tide.flac', fname = '09-Red Tide.flac', directory_id = 1360, title = '09-Red Tide.flac', artist = 'Unknown artist', album = 'Unknown album', album_artist = 'Unknown artist', genre = 'Unknown genre', comment = NULL, type = 'flac', composer = NULL, orchestra = NULL, conductor = NULL, grouping = NULL, url = NULL, bitrate = 884, samplerate = 44100, song_length = 270466, file_size = 29904931, year = 0, date_released = 0, track = 9, total_tracks = 0, disc = 1, total_discs = 0, bpm = 0, compilation = 0, artwork = 0, rating = daap_no_zero(0, rating), play_count = daap_no_zero(0, play_count), skip_count = daap_no_zero(0, skip_count), seek = daap_no_zero(0, seek), data_kind = 0, media_kind = 1, item_kind = 2, description = 'FLAC audio file', db_timestamp = 1698344752, time_added = daap_no_zero(0, time_added), time_modified = 1698344657, time_played = daap_no_zero(0, time_played), time_skipped = daap_no_zero(0, time_skipped), disabled = 0, sample_count = 0, codectype = 'flac', idx = 0, has_video = 0, contentrating = 0, bits_per_sample = 16, tv_series_name = NULL, tv_episode_num_str = NULL, tv_network_name = NULL, tv_episode_sort = 0, tv_season_num = 0, songartistid = 4187901437947843388, songalbumid = 4201163758598356043, title_sort = '00009-Red Tide.flac', artist_sort = 'Unknown artist', album_sort = 'Unknown album', album_artist_sort = 'Unknown artist', composer_sort = NULL, channels = 2, usermark = 0, scan_kind = 1, lyrics = NULL WHERE id = 12110;'
[2023-10-26 19:25:52] [DEBUG]    cache: Running query 'UPDATE artwork SET db_timestamp = 1698344752 WHERE filepath = '/media/NAS/music/Music Library/Rush/Presto/09-Red Tide.flac' AND db_timestamp >= 1698344657;'

Yet ffprobe on the file gives this:
ffprobe "09-Red Tide.flac"
ffprobe version 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 Copyright (c) 2007-2021 the FFmpeg developers
  built with gcc 11 (Ubuntu 11.2.0-19ubuntu1)

    ALBUM           : Presto
    ARTIST          : Rush
    disc            : 1
    GENRE           : Rock \ Progressive
    TOTALDISCS      : 1
    TOTALTRACKS     : 11
    DATE            : 1989
    track           : 09

  Stream #0:0: Audio: flac, 44100 Hz, stereo, s16.

comment.body: Thank you!  And yes this appears to have fixed the issue.

issue.title: AppleTV 4K Audio Playback is silent
issue.body:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Get a AppleTV 4K running tvOS 17.1 and two Homepods 2 running audioOS 17.1.
2. Create a Stereo Pair and setup a fixed direct connect with AppleTV. They are now appear as only one AirPlay Device in the network, not 3 :)
3. Install Owntone from .deb Packages or via Docker to a Debian Bookworm Server
4. Import Music Library to owntone
5. Pair owntone with AppleTV 4-Digit Pin
6. Start to play some music via AirPlay to AppleTV
7. Notice that AppleTV doesn't output any audio. Notice that the Homepods light up for a breef moment. Notice that meanhile owntone repots a happy playback. Nice....

All Devices are in the same subnet. There is no firewall between them.

Logs:
[owntone.log](https://github.com/owntone/owntone-server/files/13183074/owntone.log)

What I already tried to fix the issue:
- Disable IPV6
- Moved from .deb installation to docker
- Home Settings: Allow Playback from anywhere, without password
- Restarted Homepods
- Restarted AppleTV

Version of owntone: 
28.8

Platform: 
Debian Bookworm X86_64

issue.title: Parsing m3u with BOM skips first line
issue.body:
Issue:
When a playlists contains a valid path at the very first line, and has a BOM, the first entry is ignored.

Example m3u file, utf8 with BOM, containing following two lines:
`..\Mp3_Tagged\Soundtracks\Chinatown\01 - Jerry Goldsmith - Love Theme From Chinatown.mp3`
`..\Mp3_Tagged\Other\Chet Baker\One Night in Tokyo\06 - Chet Baker - Almost Blue.mp3`
Results in only the second line beeing recognized

No big deal, since there is no problem when a playlist starts with some meta info (#...), but  a fix in a future release would be great :)

comment.body: Thanks for reporting. Should be fixed now.

issue.title: Parsing m3u with BOM skips first line
issue.body:
Issue:
When a playlists contains a valid path at the very first line, and has a BOM, the first entry is ignored.

Example m3u file, utf8 with BOM, containing following two lines:
`..\Mp3_Tagged\Soundtracks\Chinatown\01 - Jerry Goldsmith - Love Theme From Chinatown.mp3`
`..\Mp3_Tagged\Other\Chet Baker\One Night in Tokyo\06 - Chet Baker - Almost Blue.mp3`
Results in only the second line beeing recognized

No big deal, since there is no problem when a playlist starts with some meta info (#...), but  a fix in a future release would be great :)

commits.message:
[scan] Handle playlists with Unicode BOM

Closes #1674

commits.message:
[scan] Fix reading of FLAC tags

Regression from PR #1655. Closes #1673.

issue.title: Parsing m3u with BOM skips first line
issue.body:
Issue:
When a playlists contains a valid path at the very first line, and has a BOM, the first entry is ignored.

Example m3u file, utf8 with BOM, containing following two lines:
`..\Mp3_Tagged\Soundtracks\Chinatown\01 - Jerry Goldsmith - Love Theme From Chinatown.mp3`
`..\Mp3_Tagged\Other\Chet Baker\One Night in Tokyo\06 - Chet Baker - Almost Blue.mp3`
Results in only the second line beeing recognized

No big deal, since there is no problem when a playlist starts with some meta info (#...), but  a fix in a future release would be great :)

issue.title: [web] Request: add dark mode to web interface
issue.body: Anyone have the skills to add a dark mode to the web interface? Thank you.

comment.body: Yes, there isn't really a roadmap. It's just what myself and @hacketiwack find worth working on, and of course if interesting contributions come in. Personally, I would like to do some further Airplay improvements, but I can't say when (or if).

issue.title: [main] Allow specifying the group to use in the configuration file
issue.body:
Fix #1666 

Since owntone allows to specify the user to downgrade to, but not the group, this adds the feature to also specify the group to downgrade to.

This is backward compatible (if the gid option is missing in the owntone.conf file), it fallbacks to the previous behavior that was using the first group for the owntone specified user.

comment.body: Sorry, but like I mentioned, I don't think there is an issue with the current implementation

pull_request.title: [main] Allow specifying the group to use in the configuration file
pull_request.body:
Fix #1666 

Since owntone allows to specify the user to downgrade to, but not the group, this adds the feature to also specify the group to downgrade to.

This is backward compatible (if the gid option is missing in the owntone.conf file), it fallbacks to the previous behavior that was using the first group for the owntone specified user.

repo.name: owntone-server
repo.description: Linux/FreeBSD DAAP (iTunes) and MPD media server with support for AirPlay 1 and 2 speakers (multiroom), Apple Remote (and compatibles), Chromecast, Spotify and internet radio.

issue.title: Let Github actions rebuild web UI on push to web-src
issue.body:
@hacketiwack I think it would be good if Github actions was used to automatically rebuild the web UI whenever a change is pushed to web-src. Thus, there is no relying on the build on a local machine, and the rebuilt UI can be kept out of a PR.

Let me know if you have any concerns about this.

comment.body:
> But I have a guiding principle that says that no generated files must be placed in the source control repository.
Indeed, the build script of OwnTone, must include the generation of htdocs as well.

Yes, I agree, but it is difficult in practice. You may have seen PR #1439 where chme worked on this. One of the obstacles is that the node build needs to pull in resources from the internet. This doesn't work well with some package builders, and maybe it is also against Debian policies. I guess it also makes the build non-deterministic by nature, which is also against Debian policies, as I recall.

> Would it be possible for you to include the build of the Web UI within the Makefile?

chme's PR does do this via ("make web"), so I can try to rebase it and merge it. Maybe it also needs some dusting off. But it will just mean that the assets can be built with "make web", it won't solve the issue of having generated files in the source.

commits.message: [gh-actions] Add rebuild of web UI workflow on push to web-src
[gh-actions] No compilation workflows if just docs/htdocs/web-src changed

Merge pull request #1670 from owntone/gh_build_webui

Let Github actions rebuild web UI on push to web-src

issue.title: [web] Request: add dark mode to web interface
issue.body: Anyone have the skills to add a dark mode to the web interface? Thank you.

comment.body: @flintstones-fred there is no official roadmap for OwnTone. @ejurgensen is the original owner of OwnTone, and could potentially better answer this question.

issue.title: Let Github actions rebuild web UI on push to web-src
issue.body:
@hacketiwack I think it would be good if Github actions was used to automatically rebuild the web UI whenever a change is pushed to web-src. Thus, there is no relying on the build on a local machine, and the rebuilt UI can be kept out of a PR.

Let me know if you have any concerns about this.

comment.body:
@ejurgensen, this situation bothered me for long and I'm glad that you tackled it.

I'm OK for this temporary solution.

But I have a guiding principle that says that no generated files must be placed in the source control repository.
Indeed, the build script of OwnTone, must include the generation of `htdocs` as well.
This would solve this [work item](https://github.com/owntone/owntone-server/issues/552) as well.

I tried to fiddle around with the Makefile some months ago to not have to store the htdocs in the SCM.
But I wasn't successful at the time at finding a good example on how to do it.
Would it be possible for you to include the build of the Web UI within the Makefile?
Otherwise, I will continue my research.

Thanks in advance.
